title: Raiders fire Carroll after one season, GM remains
content: The Raiders on Monday fired coach Pete Carroll after just one season in which Las Vegas finished 3-14. General manager John Spytek will remain in his role.

title: Browns fire coach Stefanski, will keep GM Berry
content: The Browns have fired Kevin Stefanski, who was twice named the NFL's Coach of the Year over the past six seasons but also led Cleveland to consecutive last-place finishes.

title: Giants GM Schoen returning despite 4-13 season
content: The Giants will retain general manager Joe Schoen despite closing out a third straight losing season Sunday.

title: Falcons fire Morris, Fontenot despite hot finish
content: The Falcons have fired coach Raheem Morris and general manager Terry Fontenot after two straight disappointing seasons.

title: Sources: Ole Miss' Chambliss to stay if waiver OK'd
content: QB Trinidad Chambliss has agreed to a deal with Ole Miss for 2026, if the NCAA approves his pending waiver for a sixth season, sources told ESPN.

title: Rodgers fulfills Steelers' 'vision,' delivers AFC North
content: The Steelers placed their belief in Aaron Rodgers in the offseason. On Sunday night, the veteran QB showed why they were right to do so, leading Pittsburgh to a 26-24 win over Baltimore and the AFC North crown.

title: Seahawks, once long shots, now SB betting fave
content: The Seattle Seahawks, who entered the 2025 NFL season as long shots, are now +350 favorites to win Super Bowl LX, according to DraftKings lines.

title: ✍ 2026 NFL draft order: First 18 slots are set
content: The Raiders, Jets and Cardinals hold the top three picks in the 2026 NFL draft. See the rest of the order -- plus each team's top need -- after the regular season.

title: The NFL playoffs are here! Our guide to all 14 teams, from favorites to underdogs
content: The 2025 NFL playoff field is set, and an exciting wild-card round looms. Here's everything to know about the 14 teams vying to win Super Bowl LX.

title: NFL wild-card round: Rams huge favorites; Packers, Bills, Texans road favorites
content: The NFL playoffs are set. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every game in the wild-card round.

title: Kevin Stefanski out, but GM Andrew Berry stays: Next steps for Browns?
content: In search of a new coach, Cleveland enters an offseason with first-round picks and unsettled questions at QB.

title: Answering 7 questions about the Falcons' coaching, GM moves
content: Even a four-game win streak to end the season couldn't stop the firings, so where do the Falcons turn now?

title: Barnwell makes his NFL award picks: Ranking candidates for MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Drake Maye or Matthew Stafford for MVP? Which rookies should earn hardware? And no one is beating out Myles Garrett for DPOY, right?

title: Steelers escape Ravens' late push, win AFC North title
content: In a rock fight that morphed into a fourth-quarter track meet, Pittsburgh edges Baltimore to advance.

title: Man United must go big and hire a superstar manager after firing Ruben Amorim
content: It is time for one of the most powerful clubs in the world to hire a manager with the experience, track record, credentials and personality befitting Man United's status.

title: 'Fragile' no more: How the Bears' Caleb Williams, Ben Johnson evolved
content: Caleb Williams thought Ben Johnson didn't like him at one point, but the duo evolved to lead the playoff-bound Bears.

title: Sack records: Garrett makes history; Broncos' D four shy of team record
content: The Browns' vet edge rusher breaks the single-season sack record, and the Broncos' defense comes up short.

title: MVP, ROY, All-NBA teams and more: Predictions for all the league's highest honors
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton projects the favorites to win each award and make the All-NBA teams, as well as other contenders and long shots.

title: NBA insiders predict 2026: Why LeBron, trade sagas, expansion news could rock the league
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the stars, sagas and storylines that will dominate 2026.

title: NHL's best this week: Who wins a series between U.S.-Canada Olympic B-teams?
content: Many superstars were left off the rosters. Here's how two teams of snubs look -- and who would win a seven-game series.

title: VAR review: Why was Wirtz onside in Premier League, offside in Europe?
content: Liverpool had a goal from Florian Wirtz ruled out vs. Fulham, but it was overturned by VAR on the slimmest of margins. Why?

title: VAR doesn't interfere with second yellow cards. But should it?
content: Despite some major incidents lately, VAR is unable to get involved in second yellow cards. Here's why.

title: CFP semifinals first look: Previewing the penultimate round
content: How each team can win its semifinal game, plus key players and what we learned from the quarterfinals.

title: Fantasy football year in review: MVP, biggest bust and season highlights
content: A summary of the best fantasy performances, biggest storylines, surprises and disappointments, along with the usual dose of historical perspective.

title: 31.8% of Aravalli Range at risk after recent classification, says conservation group
content: The group demanded that the entire Aravalli range be declared a “fully protected zone” with the abolition of any kind of distinction between “hills” and “mountains” based on height

title: Applications invited for admissions to UG programmes including engineering and medical courses
content: Apply for admission to engineering, architecture, pharmacy, medical and medical allied courses in Kerala

title: Gujarat government suspends IAS officer arrested by ED in graft case
content: According to the ED, Mr. Patel allegedly fixed bribe rates ranging between ₹5 and ₹10 per square metre for granting approvals for change of land use

title: Four children wounded by burning painting material in Odisha school
content: Four students sustained burn injuries. Three are out of danger, while one student is undergoing treatment

title: KSRTC plans induction of 644 new buses to strengthen rural services
content: According to officials, the proposed fleet expansion will include 500 regular buses and 144 double-door mofussil buses, with a majority of these vehicles earmarked for rural routes.

title: Kidwai Memorial Institute of Oncology gets ISO 14001:2015 certification for solid waste management
content: The State-run tertiary care cancer institute is one of the few hospitals in the country that are recognised for compliance with international environmental standards

title: BJP alleges govt. allotting flats to illegal Bangladeshi immigrants; Cong. hits back
content: The BJP leaders tried to reach the Kogilu demolition site in buses to hold a protest on Monday, but were stopped by the police. The protest was held in Bagalur

title: TTD to revamp Kalyana Mandapams, digitise sacred jewellery records
content: Executive Officer orders a comprehensive status report on Kalyana Mandapams and calls for upgrades to the Facility Management System app, including QR code access, to enhance the devotee experience.

title: First Gram Sabha of Markapuram district held at Tippayapalem
content: Prakasam Collector calls upon residents to participate in the development of the district by maintaining proper personal hygiene and environmental cleanliness

title: Odisha doctors boycott OPD for two hours to demand Central pay scale
content: Over 6,000 doctors at 32 hospitals in district headquarters, 300 community health centres and other primary health centres are taking part in the strike

title: Andhra Pradesh to set up Project Monitoring Units in 46 cities to enhance urban sanitation
content: Dedicated units will provide real-time monitoring, data validation and technical support to Urban Local Bodies under Swachh Bharat Mission (Urban) 2.0, marking a shift from periodic assessments to continuous sanitation performance management

title: Supreme Court grants relief to Adani Power, sets aside customs duty on SEZ electricity
content: “In our view, the High Court, in its judgment of 2019, fell into error in accepting the submission of the Union that the later notifications continued to operate merely because they were not specifically set aside in the decision of 2015, the Supreme Court bench said

title: Bhu Suraksha project launched to digitise land records
content: Karnataka has an estimated 100 crore pages of land records, of which around 62 crore pages have already been scanned

title: 2 Presidents, Same Crime, Different Outcomes: The Trump Contradiction
content: Before deposed Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro was brought to the United States to face drug-trafficking charges, another Latin American leader had already stood trial in a US court for similar crimes. The outcome, however, was very different.

title: "Yadavs are not Hindus": Samajwadi Leader's Comment Raises Eyebrows
content: Shivraj Singh Yadav, a leader of Samajwadi Party and a close aide of party chief Akhilesh Yadav, sparked a huge controversy with his remark that "Yadavs are not Hindus".

title: Hindu Journalist Shot In The Head By Men On Bike In Bangladesh
content: In yet another incident of a Hindu man being killed in Bangladesh, a 45-year-old factory owner, who was also the acting editor of a newspaper, has been shot in the head by a group of men.

title: 11-Year-Old Girl Raped, Killed With Axe In Chhattisgarh
content: An 11-year-old girl reported missing last week was found raped and axed to death in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district, police said on Monday.

title: Indore Water Crisis Claims 17th Life, Raises Alarms Over Wider Health Impact
content: The death count in Indore's Bhagirathpura water contamination outbreak has risen to 17, intensifying fears that the crisis in India's so-called "cleanest city" is far from over and may be more dangerous than initially believed.

title: Bangladesh Court To Frame Charges In Sedition Case Against Sheikh Hasina On Jan 21
content: A Bangladesh court on Monday set January 21 as the date for framing charges in a sedition case against deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina and 285 others.

title: Iran Embassy Dismisses Reports Of Khamenei Leaving Country Amid Protests
content: A recent media report claimed that Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, 86, is preparing to leave the country along with 20 close family members amid growing anti-government protests.

title: Bengaluru Woman Techie Dies Of Suffocation After Fire Breaks Out At Home
content: A 34-year-old software engineer died of suspected suffocation after a fire broke out at her rented house in Bengaluru on the night of January 3.

title: 2 Men Rape Hindu Widow, Tie Her To Tree And Cut Her Hair In Bangladesh
content: A 40-year-old Hindu woman has allegedly been gang-raped by two men, who also tied her to a tree and cut off her hair in central Bangladesh's Kaliganj, a sub-district of Jhenaidah.

title: Top Court Allows Adani Power's Appeal, Sets Aside Order On Customs Duty
content: The Supreme Court on Monday set aside the Gujarat High Court's 2019 verdict which had declined to grant relief to Adani Power Limited over levy of customs duty on electrical energy generated in its power plant located in an SEZ

title: Father Of Woman Found Dead In US Seeks Centre's Help To Bring Back Her Body
content: The father of Nikitha Godishala, who was found dead in the US, here on Monday urged the Centre and Telangana government to help in bringing back her mortal remains.

title: Man Kills Mother, Brother, Sister In Delhi, Then Walks Into Police Station
content: A man choked to death his mother, sister and minor brother at their home in Delhi and then walked into a police station, surrendering himself to the cops, police said.

title: "Exercise Due Caution": Foreign Ministry's Advisory For Indians In Iran
content: India on Monday advised its nationals to avoid non-essential travel to Iran until further notice, owing to the recent developments in the country.

title: Fugitive Economic Offender Tag For Himachal University Promoters In In Rs 387-Crore Fake Degree Case
content: The Special PMLA Court in Shimla has declared Ashoni Kanwar and her son, Mandeep Rana, as Fugitive Economic Offenders (FEO) in connection with a multi-crore fake degree scam.

title: "Don't Want AI-Generated Forests': Top Court's Rap Over Plea To Cut 473 Trees
content: The Delhi Development Authority or DDA, which sought permission to cut 473 trees in the Delhi Ridge area to complete a road leading to the Central Armed Police Forces Institute of Medical Sciences, was pulled up by the Supreme Court today.

title: 'Never Deviated From Party Line': Shashi Tharoor Reaffirms Loyalty To Congress
content: Congress Working Committee member Shashi Tharoor, whose recent statements and article had put the party in a defensive mode, on Monday said that he had never deviated from the party line.

title: US Attacks Venezuela LIVE: Maduro, Wife At New York Court, 1st Appearance After Capture By US Forces
content: US-Venezuela Conflict Live News: Venezuela has warned that recent US military action against Caracas could set a dangerous global precedent, with the country's defence minister cautioning that such moves threaten the international order.

title: Yogi Adityanath Meets PM, Speculation Of UP Cabinet Reshuffle Intensifies
content: Speculation about a cabinet reshuffle in the Yogi Adityanath government in Uttar Pradesh has intensified after the chief minister visited Delhi and met Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and BJP President JP Nadda, among others.

title: Greenland's Strategic Significance And Why Trump "Absolutely" Wants It
content: Days after US special forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores from the capital Caracas in a nighttime airborne raid, President Donald Trump once again expressed his interest in making Greenland a part of the US.

title: World's Largest Oil Reserves, Yet Venezuela's Energy Sector Collapsed
content: In a dramatic overnight raid, US forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, and Washington officials made no secret of their primary objective: preventing America's adversaries from exploiting Venezuela's vast oil wealth.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid join chase for Wharton
content: Real Madrid have joined the race for Crystal Palace midfielder Adam Wharton. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Make these fights, UFC: Makhachev-Topuria, Jones-Pereira and more
content: From superfights to title rematches to downright epics, these 10 matchups need to be booked this year.

title: Ratha Sapthami at Tiruchanur temple on January 25
content: Devotees get rare opportunity to witness the Goddess on seven celestial vahanams in a single day procession

title: Congress to finalise candidates for Kerala Assembly polls soon
content: The proposals of the District Congress Committees alone will be considered for party nominees in the Assembly polls, as per an action plan conceived at the State leadership camp that concluded on Monday

title: Dharwad tops State in guarantee schemes implementation
content: According to State Guarantee Schemes Implementation Authority Chairman H.M. Revanna, the district has achieved 98% of the target

title: Officials told to take strict measures to curb supply and sale of Chinese manja
content: Efforts are also being made to seek support from the film industry for awareness campaigns, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests C. Suvarna said

title: Fisheries varsity seems to have no time to pursue criminal case on illegal admission of over 40 students, says HC
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy quashes unilateral demand of a higher fees of ₹6 lakh made by the university on one of the students who pleaded that she did not commit any wrong

title: Police social media monitoring cells rise from 262 to 365 in four years
content: Assam increased the number of such cells from 1 in 2022 to 37 in 2024. West Bengal expanded its network from 2 to 38 cells, while Punjab doubled its capacity, increasing the number from 24 to 48 between 2022 and 2024.

title: Doctors oppose changes to Telangana Medical Council, warn of State-wide protests against G.O. 229
content: Representatives of several doctors’ bodies objected to the ‘backdoor entry’ of non-doctors and bureaucrats, including IAS officers, into a professional regulatory body that requires clinical accountability

title: State mulls launching ‘Kerala Rice’ by revamping paddy procurement system
content: State plans cooperative-farmer-centric alternative to paddy procurement, ensuring price to the farmers at the time of procurement itself. New system in the coming season itself

title: YSRCP protests alleged injustice to Rayalaseema
content: Party leaders accuse State government of yielding to Telangana pressure and demand protection of Rayalaseema’s water rights during protest in Tirupati

title: India urges citizens to avoid non-essential travel to Iran
content: New Delhi also advised Indian citizens in Iran to exercise due caution and avoid travelling to areas witnessing protests or demonstrations

title: No eligible Indian should be left out of electoral rolls: Gyanesh Kumar
content: Gyanesh Kumar says the foundation of democracy is a ‘clean’ electoral roll and hails BLOs as vital to the process of bringing out updated voter lists

title: APGenco sets record with 6,009 MW power generation
content: Improved coal quality, focused maintenance, and timely financial measures help thermal plants achieve highest-ever output on January 4, says Managing Director

title: Politicisation of Kogilu demolition along communal lines shifts focus from homelessness, say activists
content: The Opposition Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has not only accused the Congress of ‘minority appeasement’, but has also been consistently referring to the residents as ‘Bangladeshis’, with no evidence

title: Kerala University-run CLAS faces scrutiny over erroneous foreign remittance
content: Brazil-based journalist paid $20,000 instead of approved honorarium of  ₹20,000; bank admits to lapse

title: Election Commission should safeguard rights of voters in ‘no mapping’ list: Kerala Minister P. Rajeeve
content: The Minister stressed that nobody should lose the right to exercise their franchise because of technical errors in the SIR

title: U.P. CM meets PM, BJP leadership in New Delhi
content: The meetings come amid the buzz of a Cabinet expansion in Uttar Pradesh as the party is looking to reshape its caste and regional calculus in view of the upcoming panchayat elections, and next year’s crucial Assembly election

title: Universities must strengthen ties with industry, says Lokesh
content: IT and HRD Minister stresses need for periodic curriculum updates and financial self-reliance through alumni networks; Governor emphasises NIRF rankings and R&D focus

title: Indoor trout farm near Hyderabad eyeing year-round production opened
content: Temperature-controlled aquaculture systems can overcome traditional geographical and climatic limitations, opening new possibilities for fisheries development across the country, Union Minister said at the inauguration of the facility

title: TTD begins documentation for Alipiri Padala Mandapam restoration
content: Every architectural component-roof slabs, beams, wall members, flooring stones, and structural joints, will be individually identified, assigned a unique documentation number and marked with visible, non-invasive paint

title: International workshop in Shivamogga focuses on climate-resilient agriculture solutions
content: A five-day international workshop for early-career researchers has begun in Shivamogga. Experts and scientists from various organisations are participating.

title: DCC Bank employees stage protest in Belagavi, Savadi supporters in Athani
content: A bank union leader has filed a complaint against the Congress MLA, his son and supporters for assaulting him in his house over a transfer issue

title: Eleven-year-old girl sexually assaulted and murdered in Chhattisgarh, accused held
content: According to the police, the accused was a family acquaintance of the victim and regularly visited her house in Narayanpur

title: Building card, Digi Door PIN features of K-Smart to help avoid hassles of address change after delimitation
content: Digi Door PIN will include geotagging and integration of all major utility databases of a building. A number will be allotted after geo-mapping the longitudes and latitudes of each building and the number will not change

title: AAP faces exodus in Goa: ex-State unit chief Palekar, acting president Parab, 3 others resign
content: Amit Palekar was removed from the post of Goa AAP president late last month after the party faced a humiliating defeat in the Zilla Panchayat polls

title: IUML to seek larger seat share in UDF following its local body performance
content: League’s tally jumped by nearly 40% in the local body polls with the party securing 3,203 representatives across the State, up from 2,338 in 2020. P.M.A. Salam says the party is ready to make compromise if new parties join the UDF

title: 'Will take up arms': Colombia prez unfazed by Trump's threats; what ex-guerrilla fighter said
content: Colombian President Gustavo Petro declared he would "take up arms" after US President Donald Trump threatened military action and accused him of drug trafficking. Petro defended Colombia's anti-narcotics strategy, warning that excessive force could lead to civilian casualties and a surge in guerrilla activity. The exchange follows a US operation in Venezuela that captured President Maduro.

title: Hindu widow raped, tortured in Bangladesh: Accused tie her to tree, cut hair; 2 held
content: A Hindu widow in Bangladesh was brutally tortured, raped, and had her hair cut by a local man who had made repeated indecent advances. The 40-year-old victim was attacked after rejecting the advances of a man from whom she had purchased property. Two men have been arrested following her complaint.

title: 'Crazy person': Vance's first reaction after attack on home; where was Veep?
content: US Vice President JD Vance's Cincinnati home was attacked overnight, with several windows smashed. Secret Service and Cincinnati police responded swiftly, taking a suspect into custody. Vance, who was in Washington D.C. at the time, expressed gratitude for the quick response and requested media discretion regarding images of the damage.

title: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi smashes South Africa, hits 10 sixes in quickfire fifty
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, the 14-year-old captain, unleashed a blistering 68 off 24 balls, including ten sixes, to power India's chase against South Africa Under-19. His explosive start set the tone after South Africa posted 245, anchored by Jason Rowles' 114. This performance highlights Sooryavanshi's formidable form ahead of the U-19 World Cup.

title: When Amazon founder Jeff Bezos agreed that AI is in an 'industrial bubble' with investors who ...
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos has warned that the current excitement around artificial intelligence is creating an 'industrial bubble,' with significant investor funding flowing into companies regardless of strong fundamentals. Despite this caution, Bezos affirmed that AI is a real and transformative technology that will ultimately benefit society, drawing parallels to the 1990s biotech bubble.

title: Budget 2026: When retirement becomes a tax trap - why salary earners need urgent relief
content: The first shock for employees came with the Finance Act, 2020, which capped employer contributions to recognised PF, approved superannuation funds and NPS at ₹7.5 lakh per year.

title: Ashes: 'Not playing to survive' - Joe Root defends Smith after poor dismissal
content: Smith backed away to hit a shoulder-high short ball over the off side but found Scott Boland at deep cover. He was dismissed by part-time pacer Marnus Labuschagne for 46 off 76 balls. The new ball was taken five to six overs after his dismissal.

title: AI debate: Mathematician Joel Hamkins warns; ‘LLMs give wrong answers’
content: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.

title: 'Stronger than ever': Trump claims $600 bn tariff collection 'soon'; hits at 'fake media'
content: Donald Trump claimed that US will soon receive $600 billion in tariff collections, while criticizing media for not reporting it, calling them 'fake news media' and saying that they "hate and disrespect" US . He further criticised the ongoing case in Supreme Court citing "national security" and calling it the "one of the most important decision ever".

title: Delhi blast: Al-Falah University now in pollution dock; hostel project halted
content: Haryana's pollution watchdog has shut down construction at Al-Falah University for violating air quality norms and proceeding without environmental permits. Tests revealed the university's treated wastewater exceeded pollution limits, prompting legal action. The university also failed to register as a bulk waste generator and lacked basic dust control measures during construction.

title: OpenAI IPO plans: Sam Altman says he has no interest in public company CEO role
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has expressed zero enthusiasm for leading a public company, despite acknowledging an IPO is likely necessary for capital and growth.  While he finds public market participation in value creation appealing, he anticipates the process will be 'annoying.'  The AI giant, valued at potentially $1 trillion, is reportedly preparing for a 2026 or 2027 listing.

title: 'A perfect blueprint': Xi is watching — will China do a Venezuela on Taiwan?
content: In a dramatic shift that overturns post-Cold War expectations, the United States has taken the extraordinary step of capturing Venezuela's president and asserting its control over the nation. This provocative act ignites concerns in Asia, as observers wonder if Xi Jinping could seize the moment to challenge Taiwan, thereby probing the boundaries of what international law allows for powerful nations.

title: Agastya Nanda on being Amitabh Bachchan’s grandson: ‘That’s not my legacy’
content: Agastya Nanda, debuting in 'Ikkis', asserts his identity solely as 'Nanda', distancing himself from the legacies of his famous grandparents, Amitabh Bachchan and Raj Kapoor. He emphasizes focusing on making his father proud, rather than aspiring to emulate other accomplished family members in his acting career.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly shaken by Travis Kelce’s confession ahead of wedding
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have been dealing with a lot on their plate ever since they announced their engagement last year. While the two have kept themselves busy with planning their wedding, it seems Taylor Swift is deeply unsettled by some of Travis Kelce's words that he has said in public about his past. It seems this has become a huge deal for Taylor Swift ahead of their wedding.

title: Vanessa Bryant says friends pushed her forward long after Kobe’s Lakers legacy
content: Vanessa Bryant, widow of NBA legend Kobe Bryant, continues to champion the Mamba & Mambacita Sports Foundation. Recently, she shared a striking photo, crediting her friends for encouraging her to be more present in pictures.  She also celebrated Taylor Swift wearing Kobe Bryant merchandise, a gesture her daughters, avid Swifties, would appreciate.

title: GCL: Coaching three Candidates in one team; Thipsay’s masterclass behind SG Pipers’ title
content: SG Pipers, featuring three Candidates 2026 qualifiers, defied expectations to win the Global Chess League Season 3. Coach Pravin Thipsay revealed that overconfidence on the top boards led to struggles, with the lower-ranked players ultimately carrying the team to victory.

title: 'Delay in trial not trump card': No relief for Umar, Sharjeel in riots case — why SC denied bail
content: The Supreme Court denied bail to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam in the 2020 Delhi riots case, citing a prima facie case under UAPA. The court found they played a "formative role" in the conspiracy. However, five other accused were granted bail with strict conditions. Khalid and Imam can seek bail again after one year.

title: Chopper, armoured vehicle: Armed soldiers escort 'limping' Maduro to New York court - watch
content: Deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro arrived in Manhattan for his first US court appearance on narcotrafficking and weapons charges. He was seen in a prison jumpsuit, escorted by DEA agents, with his wife also in custody. The charges allege Maduro led a criminal network for over 25 years, facilitating cocaine shipments into the US.

title: ‘No leniency’: Iran green lights crackdown against ‘rioters’ amid Trump’s warning
content: Iran's judiciary chief vows no leniency for "rioters" despite acknowledging public protest rights amid ongoing economic demonstrations. Protests, fueled by currency devaluation and inflation, have spread across provinces, with authorities distinguishing between protesters and those causing violence. The unrest occurs amidst significant economic pressure and international attention.

title: Kohli in a MrBeast video? YouTuber says 'trying to film with you'
content: ​​He said, "Hey Virat Kohli, I'm trying to film with you," while also highlighting India as one of his biggest audience bases.

title: 'Mogambo khush hua': Kharge likens Trump's actions to Hitler; takes shot at PM
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge compared US President Donald Trump to dictators Hitler and Mussolini, criticising US actions in Venezuela and Trump's alleged attempts to intimidate global leaders. Kharge also accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of yielding to Trump's demands regarding Russian oil purchases, citing a film dialogue to illustrate the prime minister's perceived subservience to the US leader.

title: What goes wrong after take-off: A spate of fatal paragliding crashes raises alarm
content: Himachal Pradesh, a popular adventure spot, has seen a rise in paragliding accidents. These incidents have tragically resulted in the deaths of both local and foreign tourists. Factors like pilot error, equipment failure, and poor weather conditions contribute to these crashes. Authorities are implementing new safety measures to prevent future tragedies and ensure the safety of adventure enthusiasts.

title: Why does aluminium foil spark in a microwave but not in an oven
content: Ever wondered why aluminium foil sparks in microwaves but not conventional ovens?  It's all about how energy is delivered. Microwaves create intense electromagnetic fields that cause charge to build up on foil's sharp edges, leading to sparks. Conventional ovens, however, use gentle heat, allowing foil to absorb warmth safely without electrical discharge.

title: US VP's house attacked: Windows smashed; suspect in custody
content: The home of US Vice President JD Vance in Cincinnati faced an attack in early hours of Monday. Several windows were smashed at his residence. The Secret Service and local police responded swiftly. A person has been taken into custody following the incident. Authorities are investigating the matter. Vance's office stated security concerns influence his and the President's co-location.

title: Rahul vs Priyanka? Will Cong's Assam move change party leadership dynamics?
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's appointment as chairperson of the Assam election screening committee fuels leadership debate, with the BJP alleging internal conflict between her and Rahul Gandhi. The Congress dismisses these claims, asserting her experience and organizational capabilities. This move, amidst whispers of her potential elevation, comes as the party seeks to regain ground in Assam.

title: Stock markets may deliver gains of up to 15%! What Mark Mobius expects
content: Veteran investor Mark Mobius sees strong future growth for India. He expects double-digit returns, around 12-15 percent. Mobius has invested almost 30 percent of his portfolio in India. He believes India's economic reforms and easing investment bottlenecks will drive this growth. He also notes India's potential to outperform China due to favorable market dynamics and supply chain shifts.

title: Captain Meg will take all pressure: UP Warriorz head coach Abhishek Nayar
content: Explaining why he chose to name Meg Lanning as the captain of UP Warriorz for WPL-4 during his team’s pre-season presser on Monday, Nayar termed the Australian legend, who thrice led the Delhi Capitals to the WPL final, as “the best mind out there in women’s cricket.”​​

title: Varanasi release date: Mahesh Babu–SS Rajamouli film eyes festival launch
content: Mahesh Babu and SS Rajamouli's highly anticipated film, 'Varanasi,' is reportedly eyeing a grand worldwide release on April 9, 2027. This date is speculated to coincide with Sri Rama Navami, adding to the film's significance. With a massive budget and a star-studded cast, 'Varanasi' promises a global scale action-drama experience.

title: ‘Human sacrifice’ plot for hidden treasure: 8-month-old rescued from house; couple detained
content: A tip-off to child helpline 1098 averted a suspected child sacrifice in Sulibele, near Bengaluru. Officials rescued an eight-month-old boy from a couple claiming to be his parents, who were allegedly planning a ritual for hidden treasure. The couple, who had illegally adopted the child, denied the allegations, but contradictory statements and a freshly dug pit raised alarm.

title: Ten technology trends to watch in 2026
content: After years of AI hype, 2026 brings a reality check. Companies need to prove their billion-dollar bets are worth it. Data centres are spreading globally, straining power grids. AI agents are moving from pilots to production. Robots are getting smarter. New hardware forms are arriving. Meanwhile, tech billionaires keep getting richer. The gap between hype and deployment is shrinking fast, and 2026 could turn out to be a real pivoting year.

title: Trump flips Monroe into Donroe: How US plans to reshape the Western Hemisphere — explained
content: US President Donald Trump has revived and expanded the Monroe Doctrine, now dubbed the "Donroe Doctrine," to assert American dominance across the Western Hemisphere. This aggressive approach has led to military action in Venezuela, threats against Cuba and Colombia, and ambitions for Greenland, signaling a significant shift in US foreign policy.

title: Last-minute call? Kohli to miss Delhi’s Vijay Hazare match tomorrow
content: Star batter Virat Kohli has withdrawn from Delhi's Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Railways, a decision confirmed by Delhi coach Sarandeep Singh. Kohli had previously met the BCCI mandate by playing two games, scoring impressively. His absence means he won't face pacer Himanshu Sangwan before joining the India squad for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand.

title: Quote of the day Epicurus: “Do not spoil what you have by desiring…”
content: Ancient Greek philosopher Epicurus, founder of "The Garden," advocated for moderation and clear-headedness, not indulgence. He believed true pleasure lies in the absence of pain and worry, achieved by recognizing and being satisfied with life's simpler joys.

title: ‘Ab yahi zindagi hai’: Umar Khalid reacts after SC denies bail; partner shares brief chat
content: Umar Khalid, denied bail by the Supreme Court in the 2020 Delhi riots case, stated prison is now his life. While he expressed happiness for co-accused granted bail, the court found a prima facie case against him under UAPA. The Supreme Court also noted that trial delays don't automatically override UAPA safeguards.

title: 'Unlucky to miss out': AB de Villiers explains why India ignored this star player
content: Former Proteas star AB de Villiers believes Mohammed Siraj's T20 World Cup snub stems from team balance, not form.  He highlighted India's preference for all-rounders like Harshit Rana and a spin-heavy strategy, seeing Siraj as unlucky but crucial for future ODI plans.  De Villiers feels India's bowling depth covers all bases for championship success.

title: Andrew McCutchen & Maria Hanslovan net worth: MLB earnings, contracts and assets
content: Andrew McCutchen's stellar MLB career, marked by five All-Star selections and an MVP award, has been the bedrock of his substantial finances, amassing over $131 million from contracts. His wife, Maria Hanslovan, contributes significantly through her thriving fitness and wellness career. Together, their combined net worth is estimated between $60-$65 million, bolstered by endorsements and joint assets.

title: Andhra Pradesh: Massive gas leak at ONGC well in Konaseema triggers fire - video
content: No deaths or injuries were reported in the incident, according to preliminary information shared by an official of the Maharatna company. Deep Industries Ltd, a Production Enhancement Contractor (PEC) of ONGC, had secured a Rs 1,402-crore contract in 2024 for production enhancement operations at ONGC’s Rajahmundry Asset in Andhra Pradesh, according to reports.

title: SpaceX starts 2026 with an important launch: Italy’s new eye in orbit
content: SpaceX kicked off 2026 with a successful launch of Italy's COSMO SkyMed Second Generation satellite from California. This radar observation satellite, designed for both civilian and military use, highlights Italy's ongoing space program and SpaceX's reliable service. The mission, despite minor delays, underscores SpaceX's commitment to international partnerships and its role as a dependable launch provider.

title: Barak-8, drones: How India will fight future wars; Rs79k cr-defence push to counter Pak, China
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council approved nearly Rs 79,000 crore in military modernization projects, including air defense missiles, combat drones, and long-range rockets. These crucial acquisitions aim to bolster operational readiness against evolving threats from China and Pakistan, emphasizing speed, precision, and multi-domain warfare capabilities.

title: 'Don't play games': US issues blunt warning to Iran; calls US Prez 'man of action'
content: The US State Department issued a stern warning to Iran's leadership, emphasizing President Trump's readiness to act as nationwide unrest escalates.  Trump vowed to 'rescue' protesters if Iranian forces use deadly force, stating the US is 'locked and loaded.'  Demonstrations, fueled by economic woes and civil disobedience, feature chants against the regime.

title: Man United fires coach Amorim after 14 months

title: 'Took Rs 1.5cr insurance': Man kills mother and two siblings; confesses chilling crime to police

title: Ranking the best QBs in the transfer portal
content: ESPN's rankings of the top quarterbacks in the transfer portal . the most coveted passers on the board are quickly locking in decisions on their next stop . a year later, it's Indiana, Oregon, Ole Miss and Miami in the college football playoff semifinals .

title: How Cowboys wasted one of Dak Prescott's best seasons
content: dak Prescott had surgery for a right hamstring avulsion that ended his 2024 season . it was the third time in five seasons he had missed significant time because of injury . he threw for more than 4,000 yards and had at least 30 touchdown passes .

title: Offseason guide for eliminated NFL teams
content: the 2026 offseason has begun for the 18 teams that did not make the postseason . we have next steps for all 18 franchises . what big decisions are on deck for each front office? we have a big offseason prediction for every eliminated team .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance, more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: 'Sledgehammer': Trump targets India, China & Brazil; tariff threats loom over Russian oil

title: Tracking NFL coaching changes: Five openings after the Raiders, Browns and Falcons make changes
content: the los Vegas Raiders fired head coach Pete Carroll after one season . he became the fifth team to dismiss its head coach during the 2025 offseason . there have been at least five head coaching changes in 15 straight seasons .

title: Bengals keeping coach Taylor, top executive Tobin
content: the Bengals are bringing back head coach Zac Taylor and director of player personnel Duke Tobin . the team missed the playoffs for the third straight season as franchise quarterback Joe Burrow missed nine games with turf toe, which required surgery, finishing 6-11.

title: Testing grit and willpower with 7 marathons, 7 continents in 7 days
content: WOLF's FANG RUNWAY in Antarctica ranks among the most desolate, unwelcoming places on the planet . 54 runners stepped off their charter plane on Nov. 16 and steeled themselves for the 26.2 miles of marathon hell ahead . the race took them in a matter of hours from the lung-freezing cold of Antarctica to the 94-degree heat of Perth, Australia .

title: Jags resurface Sean Payton's 'small-market' comment to lead Week 18 trolls

title: FCS national championship preview: Illinois State, Montana State starving for title
content: NDSU came within 37 seconds of a national title in 2014 . the Bobcats came up three points short of the title . they're the first team to win four road games in a single playoff run . it's their first title game since the 2014 heartbreath of FCS .

title: NBA buzz: Live updates, trades and intel from around the league
content: the trade deadline is Feb. 5 at 3 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on all the buzz around the league as the 2025-26 season heats up . the unofficial kick off to trade season happened on Dec. 15 . nearly 90% of players become eligible to be moved -- it'll get hotter from here .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Pistons, Knicks and big questions along the race for the East's top seed
content: the new york Knicks and Detroit Pistons face off as the top two seeds in the Eastern Conference . the two teams have ramped-up expectations for the first time since the series . they are the newly crowned NBA Cup champions, led by the steady Brunson .
